name: Vault
description: Ownable is used because solidity complain trying to deploy a contract whose code is too large when everything is added into Lord of Coin contract. The only owner function is `init` which is to setup for the first time after deployment. After init finished, owner will be renounced automatically. owner() function will return 0x0 address.

functionDecorators.name: deposit
functionDecorators.description: Deposits reserve into savingsAccount. It is part of Vault's interface.

functionDecorators.name: getBalance
functionDecorators.description: Returns balance in reserve from the savings contract. It is part of Vault's interface.

returnDecorators.name: balance
returnDecorators.description: Reserve amount in the savings contract.

functionDecorators.name: init
functionDecorators.description: Setup for the first time after deploy and renounce ownership immediately.

functionDecorators.name: migrateSavings
functionDecorators.description: Allows anyone to migrate all reserve to new savings contract. Only use if the savingsContract has been changed by governance.

functionDecorators.name: nexusGovernance
functionDecorators.description: mStable governance proxy contract. It should not change.

functionDecorators.name: owner
functionDecorators.description: Returns the address of the current owner.

functionDecorators.name: redeem
functionDecorators.description: Redeems reserve from savingsAccount. It is part of Vault's interface.

functionDecorators.name: renounceOwnership
functionDecorators.description: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

functionDecorators.name: savingsContract
functionDecorators.description: mStable savingsContract contract. It can be changed through governance.

functionDecorators.name: transferOwnership
functionDecorators.description: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
